sen.j: 牧野 誠成（まきの たかしげ）は、丹後田辺藩の第9代藩主。
sen.e: Takashige MAKINO was the ninth head of Tanabe Domain of Tango Province.
Takashige MAKINO was the ninth head of Tanabe Domain of Tango Province.

He was the tenth generation of Makino family in Tanabe Domain of Tango Province.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）5月19日、第8代藩主・牧野節成の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born on May 19, 1832 as the eldest son of the eighth lord of domain, Tokishige MAKINO.
He was born on May 19, 1832, as the eldest son of the eighth lord of the domain, Tokishige MAKINO.
He was born on June 17, 1832, as the eldest son of the eighth lord of the domain, Tokishige MAKINO.

sen.j: 嘉永5年（1852年）6月5日、父が病気で隠居したため、家督を継いで第9代藩主となった。
sen.e: On June 5, 1852, his father retired due to illness, so he succeeded reigns of the family and became the ninth lord of domain.
On June 5, 1852, his father retired due to illness, so he took over as head of the family and became the ninth lord of domain.
On July 21, 1852, his father retired due to illness, so he took over as head of the family and became the ninth lord of domain.

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）2月に大坂加番に任じられる。
sen.e: In February 1855, he was appointed to Osaka-kaban (a person to guard Osaka-jo Castle).
In February 1855, he was appointed to Osaka-kaban (a guard at Osaka-jo Castle).
In March 1855, he was appointed to Osaka-kaban (a guard at Osaka-jo Castle).

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）3月に二条城警備、7月の禁門の変では幕府方として参加して御所の警備を務めた。
sen.e: He guarded Nijo-jo Castle in March 1864, and gosho (Imperial Palace) in July by joining Kinmon Incident as stand for the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
He guarded Nijo-jo Castle in March 1864, and the Imperial Palace in July by joining in the Kinmon Incident on the side of the Shogunate.
He guarded Nijo-jo Castle in April 1864, and the Imperial Palace in August by joining in the Kinmon Incident on the side of the Shogunate.

sen.j: 8月の第1次長州征伐では第14代将軍・徳川家茂の警護を務めている。
sen.e: In August, he guarded Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun during the First conquest of Choshu.
In August, he guarded Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun during the first conquest of Choshu.
sen.cmt: no reason for “first” to be capitalized
sen.e: In September, he guarded Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun during the first conquest of Choshu.

sen.j: これらの功績から、9月10日には奏者番に任じられた。
sen.e: With these achievements, he was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) on September 10.
With these achievements, he was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies) on September 10.
With these achievements, he was appointed to sojaban (an official in charge of ceremonies) on October 10.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）の第2次長州征伐では、丹後近海の海防などを理由に本国待機を許されている。
sen.e: During the Second conquest of Choshu in 1866, he was allowed to stay in his province because he needed to defense coast of adjacent sea of Tango.
During the second conquest of Choshu in 1866, he was allowed to stay in his province because he needed to defend the coast.

sen.j: この頃から誠成は病に倒れるようになり、慶応4年（1868年）の戊辰戦争では新政府に属している。
sen.e: Around this time, Takashige was taken with illness and belonged to new government during Boshin Civil War in 1868.
Around this time Takashige took ill, and joined the new government during the Boshin Civil War in 1868.
sen.cmt: rephrased to make it more natural
sen.e: Around this time Takashige took ill, and joined the new government during the Boshin Civil War in 1868.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）3月5日に田辺で死去。
sen.e: He died in Tanabe on March 5, 1869.

sen.j: 後を長男・弼成が継いだ。
sen.e: His son Sukeshige succeeded his family.

sen.j: 誠成自身は開国論者であり、開明的な藩主といわれている。
sen.e: Takashige was a supporter for the opening of the country and said to be a open and liberal lord of domain.
Takashige supported opening the country, and was said to be a open and liberal lord.

sen.j: 藩政では砲台の建設、藩校の増改築に務めて学問を奨励した。
sen.e: On domain duties, he worked on construction of gun battery and extension or reconstruction of hanko (a domain school).
Among his domain duties, he worked on construction of a gun battery and extension or reconstruction of a school.

sen.j: また、能書家であったともいわれる。
